page.title: 09CHELWORTH ESTATE
page.content: Mrs Alleban said she expected to see { a disused air field}as she had seen it on an old O.S. map. When we drove to the end of the road on the top lefthand corner of our squares we found a sign saying GOVERNMENT COMMUNICATIONS HEADQUARTERS EXPERIMENTAL RADIO. NO ADMITTANCE WITHOUT PRIOR AUTHORITY. Petroleum lorries ran from the nearby {oilwells}.A pipeline is being laid southwards to carry the oil to Southampton. There was a{grassdrying}plant . The owners let the local school view the process. On July 16 1985,a frontpage exclusive in the Evening Advertiser revealed that a 300_ton Common Market butter mountain was stored at Whitehall Poultry Products,Chelworth Industrial Estate,Cricklade.
